forgot to mention...the Shinsengumi overshadowed other groups not only
because of Ikedaya but because their [rules] were the most
strict~seppuku*...maybe Saitou felt that the Shinsengumi were as
samurai as you can get...by imposing seppuku they weren't just all
"talk" (however I don't ~think~ they had time to chase after deserters)

*seppuku (the history of seppuku is interesting it goes in and out of
"fashion" and the revolution allowed for a climate of ruthlessness and
intense nostalgia) its like they understood perfectly that they could
be the last members of their way of life.

secretarytocapt3
